website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for anyone who needs waterproof socks that can stand up to wetness and cold temperatures.
pros: Thick material is great for outdoor activities in cold, inclement weather
cons: Somewhat bulky, and not ideal for warm weather
Sizes run a bit on the small side

customer_reviews.title: Run slightly small
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these, one for my wife and one for myself. Since we were each on the cusp of two sizes, her Small and Medium, me Medium and Large I ordered 1 L, 2 M and 1 S. We each found the larger size to be much more comfortable so I'd say they tend to run a little small. We were also afraid they might shrink a little. Just testing them they seem very warm, but we still have to wear them in the snow and see how they actually perform.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bulky, hot, and uncomfortable. This might be appropriate if you are planning to trek across Antarctica, but you'll still have to deal with the scratchy inner liner. I had intended to use them wading through 40-degree streams, but absolutely not. They're so thick, I nearly couldn't force my water shoes over them and the shoes are normally very roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Drastic

customer_reviews.title: excellent cold socks
customer_reviews.text: good very quality products, the only thing is that they dont specify that they are thicker than normal socks, so keep this in mind when shopping, they feel like having 2-3 socks on
customer_reviews.author: madanavc

customer_reviews.title: The perfect sock for cold or wet!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for those who are out in the wet outdoors of the Pacific northwest or those who wear waders while fishing and want to keep their feet dry. How many times do you go hiking and cross a stream in your water proof hiking boots only to have the water come over the top of your boot. Now you can hike the rest of the day with a wet foot. Or, how about pulling on that half frozen wet boot the next morning. These socks are waterproof. The extra thick ones will keep your feet warm and dry while your boot warms up. Yes, they are pricy, but I love them.
customer_reviews.author: James Black

customer_reviews.title: dry and warm hiking in snow
customer_reviews.text: I just hiked mt baldy just over 10,000 feet only used light weight mesh shoes and these socks. it's a 11 mile loop and about 3 Miles into it I put them on thinking i would change out of them after i got out of the snow but really they still felt great so just kept them on because my shoes where still wet but my feet dry and warm the merino wool inside is the best part.
customer_reviews.author: Mike schults

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how they do it but my feet stays dry and comfortable while cycling through mud and rain
customer_reviews.text: Magic socks. Don't know how they do it but my feet stays dry and comfortable while cycling through mud and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These socks have proven indispensable during the current frigid weather here in NY State. My most comforatble dog-walking boots don't have much insulation, but a silk undersock + these SealSkinz have kept my feet quite toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of sizing.
customer_reviews.text: They should make specific sizes for men and women and not just unisex. I ordered a medium according to the shoe size chart. But I’m a woman with a slender foot so these socks are huge! I can’t fit my foot into my shoe wearing these because the toe area bunches up. They may be waterproof but I’ll never be able to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product wear it hunting in my boots/waders daily feet are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: cm21

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son was happy to get these as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy's Closet

customer_reviews.title: Super warm.
customer_reviews.text: Super warm although a little stiff. Keeps my feet toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Weiss

product_meta.title: SEALSKINZ Waterproof Trekking Thick Mid Sock
product_meta.description: The original, 100% waterproof, windproof & breathable mid length sock. The inner lining is crafted from fine Merino Wool to insulate and regulate temperature making this perfect for use in very cold conditions.
feature_bullets: Waterproof - three layer construction for warmth, durability and waterproofing
Comfort - Merino wool lining for moisture control, insulation and comfort
Support - zonal elastication for added support
Close fit - four way stretch for comfort and stretch fit
Anti-Blister - Prevents friction and rubbing which eliminates blistering
